content.title: Conventional Angiography
content.definition: Conventional angiography (catheter angiography) is an invasive diagnostic and therapeutic procedure using fluoroscopy and iodinated contrast injection through an arterial catheter to visualize the vascular lumen, remaining the gold standard for vascular imaging resolution and real-time intervention.

common_femoral.technique: Below inguinal ligament, over femoral head

digital_subtraction_angiography.principle: Subtracts pre-contrast image from contrast image
digital_subtraction_angiography.advantage: Removes bone/soft tissue, enhances vessel visualization

diagnostic: Suspected PAD when non-invasive tests equivocal

contrast_agents.co2: Alternative for renal insufficiency or iodine allergy
contrast_agents.gadolinium: Rarely used - nephrogenic systemic fibrosis risk

contrast_nephropathy_prevention.risk_factors: Pre-existing CKD, diabetes, volume depletion, contrast volume

content.statement: Conventional Angiography is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Diagnostics Angiography that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Conventional Angiography helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Conventional Angiography include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Conventional Angiography.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

learning_objectives: List indications for diagnostic vs therapeutic angiography
Compare angiography to non-invasive vascular imaging
clinical_pearls: Common femoral artery access over femoral head landmark
CO2 angiography is alternative for renal insufficiency
Hydration is key to preventing contrast nephropathy
DSA subtracts bone to enhance vessel visualization

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
